taxonomicnotes: There are three subordinate taxa of Azolla pinnata depending on the range of occurence. A pinnata africana is found Africa, A pinnata asiatica  in Asia and A pinnata pinnata in Oceania.
rationale: This aquatic fern is common in tropical regions of the world where it occurs in stagnant water. It can spread rapidly in and around rivers, ditches, and ponds and even in eutrophic waters. Listed as Least Concern as it is a widespread species and faces no major threats.
evaluator: Juffe Bignoli, D., Khampheng, H. & Zhuang, X.
